thread.title: Nigerian Air Force jet crashes, killing pilot: official
thread.title_full: Nigerian Air Force jet crashes, killing pilot: official

author: Wires English | Press Trust of India
title: Nigerian Air Force jet crashes, killing pilot: official
text:
Comments 
Lagos, Oct 11: A Nigerian Air Force fighter jet returning from a mission to its base in Yola, capital of northeast Adamawa state, has crashed due to bad weather, killing its pilot, the Air Force said in an official statement. The jet “returning to the base from an interdicted mission crashed due to bad weather and not under enemy fire around Hong, Adamawa State at about 1623hrs (1523 GMT). There was no survival as the pilot of the aircraft lost his life in the unfortunate incident,” the statement said yesterday. 
The statement neither said how many passengers were aboard the jet nor its precise mission in Adamawa, one of the three states in the region where Boko Haram militants have launched deadly attacks that have killed hundreds over its six-year insurgency. The Air Force authorities are investigating the cause of the crash, the statement added.
